H0.text: Mass is the factor on which the speed of a wave through connected harmonic oscillators depends, along with the distance between them and the spring constant.

H1.text: Density is the factor, along with the distance between the oscillators and the spring constant, that determines the speed of a wave through connected harmonic oscillators.

H2.text: Concentrations are the third factor that the speed of a wave through connected harmonic oscillators depends on, along with the distance between them and the spring constant.

H3.text: Temperature determines the speed of a wave through connected harmonic oscillators, along with the distance between them and the spring constant.

A4.text: the speed of propagation of an acoustic phonon... is given by the slope of the acoustic dispersion relation

A5.text: the dispersion relation is the connection between the frequency and wavevector of phonons, which depends on the spring constant, mass, and distance between oscillators
